intro: Searsia humpatensis f. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved humpatensis, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit.
